items.title: Humpback Whales and Dolphins
items.description:
New Matilda | Independent Media posted a photo:

A pair of Humpback Whales are joined by a local pod of Bottlenose Dolphins, off the coast of Minjerribah (North Stradbroke Island) in South East Queensland.

Every year, tens of thousands of Humpbacks make the annual migration from the Southern Ocean to the warmer sub-tropical waters of the Coral Sea, where they mate and give birth.

The trip north starts in late-May and ends around August, before they start heading south again around September, arriving back in the Southern Ocean by November. (IMAGE: New Matilda, September 2019)

NEW MATILDA is one of Australia's oldest and most respected independent online media outlets. All our images are free to use (in good faith), all we ask is that you credit 'New Matilda'. If you want to 'pay it forward', a link to newmatilda.com is always appreciated. Our stories are also all free - we write about some of the most disadvantaged people on earth, so our investigations and reporting don't sit behind a paywall. You can leave your email address here for a free subscription.
items.author: nobody@flickr.com ("New Matilda | Independent Media")

items.title: Whale Tail
items.description:
VinayakH posted a photo:

Whale and Dolphin Watching at Mirissa, Sri Lanka

Mirissa (Sinhala: ‡∂∏‡∑í‡∂ª‡∑í‡∑É‡∑ä‡∑É, romanized: Mirissa; Tamil: ‡ÆÆ‡Æø‡Æ∞‡Æø‡Æ∏‡Øç‡Æ∏, romanized: Miris'sa) is a small town on the south coast of Sri Lanka, located in the Matara District of the Southern Province. It is approximately 150 kilometres (93 mi) south of Colombo and is situated at an elevation of 4 metres (13 ft) above sea level. Mirissa's beach and nightlife make it a popular tourist destination. It is also a fishing port and one of the island's main whale and dolphin watching locations.
items.author: nobody@flickr.com ("VinayakH")
items.tags: whale dolphin mirissa matara srilanka sealife indianocean boattrip
